values.en: Authenticate using B2ACCESS service

Events: retrieve events based on provided criteria
Stations: retrieve stations based on provided criteria
Request: Prepare request and download data locally or stage it in the Cloud
Metrics: check quality metrics for selected data

Attach EIDA token.
EIDA Token cannot be used when downloading data using the EIDA Federator, only downloading data directly from particular datacenter is supported.
Detach EIDA token and continue as an anonymous user.
Data source catalog
Minimal event magnitude
Search starting date expressed using ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Search starting date expressed using ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Minimal event depth
Maximal event depth
Event location maximal north coordinate
Event location maximal south coordinate
Event location maximal east coordinate
Event location maximal west coordinate

Limit the number of the web service results.
Limiting number of results can help in case of Error 413: too many result
Reset form to its default values
Search for events using provided criteria
Remove all events from the working set
Remove selected events from the working set

Invert selection of events in the working set
Selected events -> Deselected events
Deselected events -> Selected events
Toggle event selection (skipped events are still in working set, but will not be included in final data package)
Remove event from working set

Browse inventory: browse EIDA inventory
User supplied: provide your own station data
Search starting year (stations closed before given year will be filtered out)
Search ending year (stations opened after given year will be filtered out)

Filter base on network type
All networks: No filtering applied
Permanent networks: Show only operational networks
Temporary networks: Show only discontinued networks

Network selection
All: all of the networks will be added to the working set
XX: network XX will be added to the set

By code: select station by code
By region: select stations using coordinate bounding box
By events: select stations based on their relative event location

Station code selection (based on the network selection dropdown)
All: all of the stations will be added to the working set
XX: station XX will be added to the set
Station location maximal north coordinate
Station location maximal south coordinate
Station location maximal east coordinate
Station location maximal west coordinate
Station minimal event distance (kilometers)
Station maximal event distance (kilometers)
Station minimal event azimuth
Station maximal event azimuth

By code: select channels by code (channels are sorted in a descending manner based on data availability)
By sampling: select channels by sampling (channels closest to the desired sampling will be selected)
Select channels (multiple selection is possible using CTRL + click / CMD + click)
Sampling rate
Reset form to its default values
Add stations to working set based on provided criteria
Remove all stations from the working set
Remove selected stations from the working set

Invert selection of stations in the working set
Selected stations -> Deselected stations
Deselected stations -> Selected stations
Select file to upload
Send selected file and add its content to the working set
Toggle station selection (skipped stations are still in working set, but will not be included in final data package)
Remove station from working set

Absolute mode: define time window based on explicit from/to timestamps (selecting events is not needed in case of absolute time window selection mode)
Relative mode: define time window based on the origin time or wave arrival time and apply optional time offsets

Start trigger type
Origin time: trigger based on event origin time
P/Pdiff: trigger based on P wave arrival time
S/SDiff: trigger based on S wave arrival time
Negative time offset in minutes preceeding the trigger

End trigger type
Origin time: trigger based on event origin time
P/Pdiff: trigger based on P wave arrival time
S/SDiff: trigger based on S wave arrival time
Positive offset in minutes following the trigger
Time window starting UTC datetime expressed using ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)
Time window ending UTC datetime expressed using ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)

Datacenter
EIDA Federator: use EIDA Federator service to automatically resolve data location
Specific datacenter: download data directly from selected datacenter

Request type
Waveform (mini-SEED): retrieve waveform data in miniSEED format
Metadata (StationXML): retrieve station metadata in StationXML format
Metadata (Text): retrieve station metadata in text format
Review the provided criteria
Download data package prepared using provided criteria
Select one of the nodes and stage data package prepared using provided criteria in the Cloud
Visualizes download progress
Select desired node and stage data package prepared using provided criteria there
Execute Cloud staging
Cancel Cloud staging
Reset map zoom to its original level
